The smaller rectangle is offset from the center of the larger rectangles. **Create the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for Part 1 with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] **Create the Sketch** Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the new coordinate system. The sketch should contain one face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1) consisting of the following curves: - line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.25] - line\\_3: Start Point [0.375, 0.25], End Point [0.25, 0.25] - line\\_4: Start Point [0.25, 0.25], End Point [0.25, 0.125] - line\\_5: Start Point [0.25, 0.125], End Point [0.125, 0.125] - line\\_6: Start Point [0.125, 0.125], End Point [0.125, 0.25] - line\\_7: Start Point [0.125, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] - line\\_8: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Ensure that loop\\_1 is closed. **Scale the Sketch** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.375. **Transform the Sketch into 3D** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. **Extrude the Sketch** Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction by 0.75 units to generate the 3D model. The remaining extrusion depth opposite the normal should be 0.0 units. The sketch scale should be set to 0.375. The operation for this part is to create a new solid body.</description>

The remaining extrusion depth opposite the normal should be 0.0 units. The sketch scale should be set to 0.375. The operation for this part is to create a new solid body.</description>
